perturbation.original_text:
2.1. Developer must submit one or more site(s) for approval, enter into binding leases or purchase
agreements and open to the public the number of El Pollo Loco® Restaurant(s) on such approved sites each
calendar year as required on the Development Schedule, all as set forth on Exhibit “B” attached hereto and
made a part hereof.
perturbation.changed_text:
2.1. Developer must submit one or more site(s) for approval, enter into binding leases or purchase
agreements and open to the public the number of El Pollo Loco® Restaurant(s) on such approved sites each
calendar year as required on the Development Schedule, all as set forth on Exhibit “B” attached hereto and
made a part hereof. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Developer shall have until March 1st of the subsequent calendar year to open restaurants scheduled for the previous year, without penalty.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction by stating that the developer must open restaurants each calendar year as per Exhibit B, but then allows them until March 1st of the following year to do so without penalty. This creates uncertainty regarding the actual deadline for opening the restaurants and when default penalties apply.

perturbation.original_text:
4.  Term of Development Agreement.
4.1. This Agreement shall commence on the date specified in Exhibit "B". Unless terminated pursuant to
Section 10 or 11 below, it shall expire upon the earlier of the date specified in Exhibit "B" or upon the opening of
the last El Pollo Loco® Restaurant listed in the Development Schedule.
perturbation.changed_text:
4.  Term of Development Agreement.
4.1. This Agreement shall commence on the date specified in Exhibit "B". Unless terminated pursuant to
Section 10 or 11 below, it shall expire five years from commencement, irrespective of Exhibit B or the opening of the last restaurant.
perturbation.explanation: This edit contradicts the original expiration terms, as it provides that the agreement expires in 5 years from commencement irrespective of the terms specified in Exhibit B, which may have different durations or be tied to specific milestones. This means the agreement could expire before all restaurants in the Development Schedule are opened or after the Development Schedule has already been met, creating uncertainty about the agreement's term.

perturbation.original_text:
10. Termination by Developer; Expiration Date.
10.1. This Agreement shall terminate immediately upon El Pollo Loco's receipt of Developer's notice to
terminate. In such event, the Development Fee shall be forfeited to Franchisor in consideration of the rights
granted in the Territory up to the time of termination. Notwithstanding any provision to the contrary contained
herein, unless earlier terminated by either party, this Agreement shall expire on ______, 20___, and all rights of
Developer herein shall cease and all unapplied or unused Development Fees paid pursuant to Section 3 hereof
shall be forfeited to Franchisor.
perturbation.changed_text:
10. Termination by Developer; Expiration Date.
10.1. This Agreement shall terminate immediately upon El Pollo Loco's receipt of Developer's notice to
terminate. In such event, 50% of the Development Fee shall be returned to the Developer. Notwithstanding any provision to the contrary contained
herein, unless earlier terminated by either party, this Agreement shall expire on ______, 20___, and all rights of
Developer herein shall cease and all unapplied or unused Development Fees paid pursuant to Section 3 hereof
shall be forfeited to Franchisor.
perturbation.explanation: This perturbation causes a conflict by stating that the Development Fee is forfeited upon the developer's termination, but then provides for a 50% refund. This creates uncertainty about the actual financial consequences of the developer terminating the agreement.
